title: Alex Mockford
text:
Alex Mockford (born 3 May 1981, in <a href="England">England</a>) is a former <a href="English%20people">English</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who played for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>, <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a>, <a href="Bristol%20Bears">Bristol</a> and <a href="Section%20Paloise">Pau</a> at the <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Number%20Eight">Number Eight</a> position.
Amateur career.
Mockford started with <a href="Sutton%20%26amp%3B%20Epsom%20RFC">Sutton and Epsom</a>.
He played with <a href="Esher%20RFC">Esher</a> from 2006 to 2008. He later played for <a href="Sutton%20%26amp%3B%20Epsom%20RFC">Sutton and Epsom</a> again.
Professional career.
He started with <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> in 1999. He stayed with them until 2003.
Mockford played with Pau in 2003-04. He played 4 matches in the European Challenge Cup for the French side.
Mockford had a trial with <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> in the <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20season">2004–05</a> season. He played a pre-season friendly against <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a>. However during the match Mockford suffered a knee injury which ultimately put paid to his Glasgow ambitions.
The injury, of a cruciate ligament, keep him sidelined from rugby for 10 months. After this lay-off he was taken on by <a href="Bristol%20Bears">Bristol</a>.
International career.
Mockford played for England at <a href="England%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">Under 18</a> and Under 19 level and for England Students.
Rugby League.
In 2006 he played a couple of trial matches for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a>.
Outside rugby.
Mockford has now built a career in marketing for the gambling industry.
